gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realised through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 sMK qoN aupdyS-krnI hIn
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realised through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: swgru Agm AQwhu miQ caudh rqn Amol kFwey
transliteration: Saagaru Agamu Adaahu Madi Chaudah Ratan Amol Kaddhaaay.
translation: It is said that after churning the Unfathomable Ocean, fourteen jewels were brought out of it.

gurmukhi: ssIAr swrMg DnKu mdu kausqk lC DnMqr pwey
transliteration: Saseearu Saarang Dhanakhu Madu Kaousatak Lachh Dhanatar Paaay.
translation: These jewels are-moon, sarang bow, wine, kaustub mani, Laksmi, the physician;

gurmukhi: AwrMBw kwmDyxu lY pwirjwqu AsÍ Aimau pIAwey
transliteration: Aaranbhaa Kaamadhaynu Lai Paarijaatu As Amiu Peeaaay.
translation: The Rambha fairy, Kanadhenu, Parijat, Uchchaisrava horse and nectar offered to gods to drink.

gurmukhi: AYrwpiq gj sMKu ibKu dyv dwnv imil vMif idvwey
transliteration: Airaapati Gaj Sankhu Bikhu Dayv Daanav Mili Vandi Divaaay.
translation: Airavat elephant, conch and poison were distributed jointly among the gods and the demons.

gurmukhi: mwxk moqI hIirAwN bhumuly sBu ko vruswey
transliteration: Maanak Motee Heeriaan Bahoumulay Sabhu Ko Varousaaay.
translation: All were given rubies, pearls and valuable diamonds.

gurmukhi: sMK smuMdHuN sKxw Dwhw dy dy roie suxwey
transliteration: Sankhu Samoundrahu Sakhanaa Dhaahaan Day Day Roi Sounaaay.
translation: Out of the ocean, conch came out empty, which tells (even today) weeping and wailing its own story that none should remain hollow and empty.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd sux gur aupdys n irdY vswey
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Gur Oupadaysu N Ridai Vasaaay.
translation: If they do not adopt the discourses and teachings of the Guru heard in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: inhPl Aihlw jnmu gvwey ]1]
transliteration: Nihaphalu Ahilaa Janamu Gavaaay ?1?
translation: They lose their life uselessly.

gurmukhi: 2 f`fU qoN aupdyS-mnmuK
translation: Manmukh, the mind oriented and frog are identical  -

gurmukhi: inrmlu nIru suhwvxw suBr srvir kvl PulMdy
transliteration: Niramalu Neeru Suhaavanaa Soubhar Saravari Kaval Phuladay.
translation: It is a pond full of pure and fine water wherein the lotuses blossom.

gurmukhi: rUp AnUp srUp Aiq gMD sugMD hoie mihkMdy
transliteration: Roop Anoop Saroop Ati Gandh Sougandh Hoi Mahakanday.
translation: Lotuses are of beautiful form and they make the environment fragrant.

gurmukhi: BvrwN vwsw vMJ vix Kojih eyko Koij lhMdy
transliteration: Bhavaraan Vaasaa Vanjh Vani Khojahi Ayko Khoji Lahanday.
translation: Black bees live in bamboo forest but they somehow search and get the lotus.

gurmukhi: loB luBiq mkrMd ris dUir idsMqir Awie imlMdy
transliteration: Lobh Loubhati Makarand Rasi Doori Disantari Aai Miladay.
translation: With the sunrise, they come attracted from far and wide and meet the lotus.

gurmukhi: sUrju ggin audoq hoie srvr kvl iDAwnu DrMdy
transliteration: Sooraju Gagani Udot Hoi Saravar Kaval Dhiaanu Dharanday.
translation: With the sunrise, the lotuses of the pond also turn their faces toward the sun.

gurmukhi: f`fU ickiV vwsu hY kvl is\\\\wix n mwix skMdy
transliteration: Dadoo Chikarhi Vaasu Hai Kavas Siaani N Maani Sakanday.
translation: Frond lives in the nearby mire close to the lotus but not understanding the real delight it cannot enjoy like lotus.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix gur aupdys n rhq rhMdy
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Gur Oupadays N Rahat Rahanday.
translation: Those unfortunate persons who listening to the teachings of the Guru in the holy congregation do not adopt them.

gurmukhi: msqik Bwg ijnHwN dy mMdy ]2]
transliteration: Masataki Bhaag Jinhaan Day Manday ?2?
translation: They are most unfortunate in life like the frogs.

gurmukhi: 3 bgly qoN aupdyS-kpt snyhI
translation: Like a crane the cheats cannot get fruits of labour  -

gurmukhi: qIriQ purib sMjog log chu kuMfwN dy Awie juVMdy
transliteration: Teeradi Purabi Sanjog Log Chahu Koundaan Day Aai Jurhanday.
translation: On pilgrimage centres, because of the anniversary festivals, millions of people get together from all the four directions.

gurmukhi: cwir vrn iCA drsnw nwm dwnu iesnwnu krMdy
transliteration: Chaari Varan Chhia Darasanaan Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Karanday.
translation: The followers of six philosophies and the four varnas make recitations, charities and take ablutions there.

gurmukhi: jp qp sMjm hom jg vrq nym kir vyd suxMdy
transliteration: Jap Tap Sanjam Hom Jag Varat Naym Kari Vayd Sounanday.
translation: Performing recitations, offering burnt offerings, fast and undertaking rigorous disciples, they listen to the recitals from the vedas.

gurmukhi: igAwn iDAwn ismrx jugiq dyvI dyv sQwn pujMdy
transliteration: Giaan Dhiaan Simaran Jougati Dayvee Dayv Sadaan Poojanday.
translation: Meditating, they adopt they techniques of recitations.

gurmukhi: bgw bgy kpVy kir smwiD AprwiD invMdy
transliteration: Bagaa Bagay Kaparhay Kari Samaadhi Aparaadhi Nivanday.
translation: Worship of gods and goddesses is performed at their respective abodes - temples.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix gurmuiK pMQ n cwl clMdy
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Guramoukhi Pand N Chaal Chaladay.
translation: White-clad persons remain engaged in trance but like a crane as and when they get opportunity they immediately stoop to commit crime.

gurmukhi: kpt snyhI Plu n lhMdy ]3]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhee Phalu N Lahanday ?3?
translation: Listening to the word of the Guru in the holy congregation, the fake lovers who do not adopt it in their life, do not attain any fruit (in their life).

gurmukhi: 4 An-AiDkwrI
translation: Even listening to the Word of the Guru, the undeserving person attains no peace-

gurmukhi: swvix vx hrIAwvly vuTY sukY Aku jvwhw
transliteration: Saavani Van Hareeaavalay Voutdai Soukai Aku Javaahaa.
translation: In the month of Savan, the whole forest becomes green but akk, a wild plant of sandy region ( Calatropis procera) and javah (a prickly plant used in medicine) go dry.

gurmukhi: qiRpiq bbIhy sÍwNiq bUMd isp AMdir moqI Emwhw
transliteration: Tripati Babeehay Saanti Boond Sip Andir Motee Oumaahaa.
translation: Getting rain drops in the savanti nakstr (a special formation of stars in the sky) the rain bird (Paphia) gets satisfied and if the same drop falls in the mouth of a shell, it is transformed into a pearl.

gurmukhi: kdlI vxhu kpUr hoie klir kvl n hoie smwhw
transliteration: Kadalee Vanahu Kapoor Hoi Kalari Kavalu N Hoi Samaahaa.
translation: In the banana fields, the same drop becomes camphor but on alkaline earth and lotus hat drop has no impact.

gurmukhi: ibsIAr muih kwlkUt hoie Dwq supwqR kupwqR durwhw
transliteration: Biseear Muhi Kaalakoot Hoi Dhaat Soupaatr Koupaatr Duraahaa.
translation: That drop, if it goes into the mouth of a snake, becomes deadly poison. Therefore, a thing given to a genuine and undeserving person has different effects.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix swNiq n AwvY auBY swhw
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Saanti N Aavai Oubhai Saahaa.
translation: Likewise, those who are engrossed in the worldly delusions do not get peace even though they listen to the word of the Guru in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprmrsu mnmuK bdrwhI bdrwhw
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Manamoukh Badaraahee Badaraahaa.
translation: The gurmukh attains the pleasure fruit of the love of the Lord, but manmukh, the mind orientated one, goes on following the evil path.

gurmukhi: mnmuK totw gurmuK lwhw ]4]
transliteration: Manamoukh Totaa Guramoukh Laahaa ?4?
translation: Manmukh always suffers loss whereas the Gurmukh earns profit.

gurmukhi: 5 AhMkwrIAwN pur diRStwNq
translation: Examples on the egotists

gurmukhi: vxvx ivic vxwspiq ieko DrqI ieko pwxI
transliteration: Van Van Vichi Vanaasapati Iko Dharatee Iko Paanee.
translation: In all the forests vegetation is there and at all the places there is the same earth and the same water.

gurmukhi: rMg ibrMgI Pul Pl swd sugMD snbMD ivfwxI
transliteration: Rang Birangee Phul Phal Saad Sougandh Sanabandh Vidaanee.
translation: This sameness notwithstanding, the fragrance, taste and colour of fruits and flowers are wondrously different.

gurmukhi: aucw isMmlu JMtulw inhPl cIl cVHY AsmwxI
transliteration: Ouchaa Sinmalu Jhantulaa Nihaphalu Cheelu Charhhai Asamaanee.
translation: The tall silk - cotton tree is of big expanse and fruitless chil tree touches the sky (these both like an egotist's person are proud of their size).

gurmukhi: jldw vwNsu vFweIAY vMJulIAwN vjin bybwxI
transliteration: Jaladaa Vaansu Vaddhaaeeai Vanjhuleeaan Vajani Bibaanee.
translation: Bamboo keeps scorching thinking of its greatness.

gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu vxwspiq vwsu rhY inrgMD rvwxI
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Vaasu Rahai Niragandh Ravaanee.
translation: Sandal makes the whole vegetation fragrant but bamboo remains devoid of fragrance.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix irdY n vsY ABwg prwxI
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Ridai N Vasai Abhaag Paraanee.
translation: Those who even listening to the word of Guru in the holy congregation do not adopt it in the heart are unfortunate.

gurmukhi: haumY AMdir Brim BulwxI ]5]
transliteration: Haoumai Andari Bharami Bhulaanee ?5?
translation: They engrossed in ego and delusions go astray.

gurmukhi: 6 au`lU qoN aupdyS-mnmuK
translation: Lesson from owl-Manmukh  -

gurmukhi: sUrju joiq audoiq kir cwnxu krY Anyru gvwey
transliteration: Sooraju Joti Udoti Kari Chaananu Karai Anayru Gavaaay.
translation: The sun with its bright rays dispels darkness and scatters light all around.

gurmukhi: ikriq ivriq jg vrqmwn sB snbMDn mukiq krwey
transliteration: Kirati Virati Jag Varatamaan Sabhanaan Bandhan Moukati Karaaay.
translation: Seeing it the whole world gets engaged in business. The sun alone liberates all from the bondage (of darkness).

gurmukhi: psu pMKI imrgwvlI BwiKAw Bwau Alwau suxwey
transliteration: Pasu Pankhee Miragaavalee Bhaakhiaa Bhaau Alaau Sounaaay.
translation: Animals, birds and the herds of deer speak in their loving tongue.

gurmukhi: bwNgwN burgU isM|IAwN nwd bwd nIswx vjwey
transliteration: Baangaan Buragoo Sineeaan Naad Baad Neesaan Vajaaay.
translation: Qazis give call (azan) for prayer, yogis blow their trumpet (sringi) and at the doors of kings drums are beaten.

gurmukhi: GuGU suJ n suJeI jwie aujwVI JiQ vlwey
transliteration: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Jaai Ujaarhee Jhadi Valaaay.
translation: Owl does not listen to either of these and spends its day in a desolate place.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix Bwau Bgiq min Bau n vswey
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Bhaau Bhagati Mani Bhau N Vasaaay.
translation: Those who even listening to the word of the Guru in the holy congregation do not cultivate loving devotion in their heart, are manmukhs.

gurmukhi: mnmuK ibrQw jnmu gvwey ]6]
transliteration: Manamoukh Biradaa Janamu Gavaaay ?6?
translation: They spend their life in vain.

gurmukhi: 7 cMd ckvw-kpt snyhI dw vwNjy rihxw
translation: The fake lover like ruddy sheldrake remains empty even in the holy congregation -

gurmukhi: cMd ckor prIq hY jgmg joiq audoqu krMdw
transliteration: Chand Chakor Pareeti Hai Jagamag Joti Udotu Karandaa.
translation: The moon, loving the redlegged partridge, makes its light shining.

gurmukhi: ikriK ibriKhuie sPlu Pil sIql swNiq Aimau vrsMdw
transliteration: Kirakhi Birakhi Hui Saphalu Phali Seetal Saanti Amiu Varasandaa.
translation: It pours the nectar of peace by which the crop, trees etc. are blest.

gurmukhi: nwir Bqwir ipAwru kir ishjw Bog sMjogu bxMdw
transliteration: Naari Bhataari Piaaru Kari Sihajaa Bhog Sanjogu Banandaa.
translation: Husband meets wife and prepares her for further joy.

gurmukhi: sBnwN rwiq imlwvVw ckvI ckvw imil ivCuVMdw
transliteration: Sabhanaa Raati Milaavarhaa Chakavee Chakavaa Mili Vichhurhandaa.
translation: All meet in the night but the male and the female ruddy sheldrake go away from each other.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix kpt snyih n Qyh lhMdw
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Kapat Sanayhi N Dayhu Lahandaa.
translation: This way, even listening to the Guru's teachings in the holy congregation the fake lover does not know the depth of love.

gurmukhi: mjlis AwvY lsxu Kwie gMdI vwsu mcwey gMdw
transliteration: Majalasi Aavai Lasanu Khaai Gandhee Vaasu Machaaay Gandaa.
translation: As the person having eaten garlic spreads malodour.

gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau mMdI hUM mMdw ]7]
transliteration: Doojaa Bhaau Mandee Hoon Mandaa ?7?
translation: The results of duality are the most bad of the worst.

gurmukhi: 8 kVCI, rqkwN-kpt snyhI
translation: Ladle, redladly bug and the cheat, -

gurmukhi: Kt rs imT rs myil kY CqIh Bojn hoin rsoeI
transliteration: Khatu Ras Mitd Ras Mayli Kai Chhateeh Bhojan Honi Rasoee.
translation: Mixing various juices sweet and sour in the kitchen food is cooked of thirty-six kinds.

gurmukhi: jyvixvwr ijvwlIAY cwir vrn iCA drsn loeI
transliteration: Jayvanivaar Jivaaleeai Chaari Varan Chhia Darasan Loee.
translation: The cook serves it to the people of all the four varnas and the followers of six philosophies.

gurmukhi: qiRpiq Bugiq kir hoie ijsu ijhbw swau is\\\\wxY soeI
transliteration: Tripati Bhougati Kari Hoi Jisu Jihabaa Saau Siaanai Soee.
translation: He alone who having eaten has satisfied himself, can understand the taste of it,

gurmukhi: kVCI swau nw sMBlY CqIh ibMjn ivic sMjoeI
transliteration: Karhachhee Saau N Sanbhalai Chhateeh Binjan Vichi Sanjoee.
translation: The ladle moves into all the dainty dishes of thirty-six type without knowing the taste of them.

gurmukhi: rqI rqk nw rlY rqnwN AMdir hwir proeI
transliteration: Ratee Ratak Naa Ralai Ratanaa Andari Haari Paroee.
translation: The red ladybug cannot mix-up among rubies and jewels because the latter are used in the strings whereas the red ladybug cannot be used in this way.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru sbdu suix gur aupdysu Awvysu n hoeI
transliteration: Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Souni Gur Oupadaysu Aavaysu N Hoee.
translation: Having even listened to the teachings of Guru in the holy congregation the cheat who does not get inspired.

gurmukhi: kpt snyh n drgh FoeI ]8]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhi N Daragah Ddhoee ?8?
translation: They do not obtain a place in the court of the Lord.

gurmukhi: 9 hwQI, quMmy vwN|U kpt snyhI
translation: The cheat lover is like elephant and colocynth,

gurmukhi: ndIAwN nwly vwhVy gMg sMg imil gMg huvMdy
transliteration: Nadeeaa Naalay Vaaharhay Gang Sang Mili Gang Huvanday.
translation: Rivers and streams become Ganges after meeting the latter.

gurmukhi: ATsiT qIrQ syNvdy dyvI dyvw syv krMdy
transliteration: Atdasatdi Teerad Sayvaday Dayvee Dayvaa Sayv Karanday.
translation: The cheats undertake to go at sixty-eight pilgrimage centres and serve gods and goddesses.

gurmukhi: lok vyd gux igAwn ivic piqq auDwrx nwau suxMdy
transliteration: Lok Vayd Goun Giaan Vichi Patit Udhaaran Naau Sounanday.
translation: They, from people during their discussions over good and knowledge, listen to the name of the Lord, the saviour of the fallen ones;

gurmukhi: hsqI nIir nHvwlIAin bwhir inkil Cwru CxMdy
transliteration: Hasatee Neeri Nhavaaleeani Baahari Nikali Chhaaru Chhananday.
translation: But, it is like the elephant who is bathed in water but coming out of it spreads dusts all round.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix guru aupdysu n iciq DrMdy
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Guru Oupadaysu N Chiti Dharanday.
translation: The cheats listen to the teachings of the Guru in the holy congregation but do not adopt them in the mind.

gurmukhi: quMmy AMmiRq isMjIAY bIjY AMmiRq Pl n PlMdy
transliteration: Tounmay Anmritu Sinjeeai Beejai Anmritu Phal N Phaladay.
translation: Even if irrigated by nectar, the seeds of colocynth never become sweet,

gurmukhi: kpt snyh n syh pujMdy ]9]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayh N Sayh Pujanday ?9?
translation: The cheating lovers never follow the straight path i.e. they do not follow the way of truth.

gurmukhi: 10 sMF vwN|U mnmuK
translation: Manmukh like a barren women

gurmukhi: rwjY dy sau rwxIAwN syjY AwvY vwro vwrI
transliteration: Raajai Day Sau Raaneeaa Sayjai Aavai Vaaro Vaaree.
translation: The king keeps hundred of queens and turn by turn visit their beds.

gurmukhi: sBy hI ptrwxIAwN rwjy iekdUM iek ipAwrI
transliteration: Sabhay Hee Pataraaneeaa Raajay Ik Doo Ik Piaaree.
translation: For the king, all are principal queens and he loves them all much and more.

gurmukhi: sBnw rwjw rwvxw suMdir mMdir syj svwrI
transliteration: Sabhanaa Raajaa Raavanaa Soundari Mandari Sayj Savaaree.
translation: Decorating the chamber and the bed, they all enjoy coition with the king.

gurmukhi: sMqiq sBnwN rwxIAwN iek ADkw sMiF ivcwrI
transliteration: Santati Sabhanaa Raaneeaan Ik Adhakaa Sanddhi Vichaaree.
translation: All the queens conceive and one or two come out to be barren.

gurmukhi: dos n rwjy rwxIAY pUrb ilKqu n imtY ilKwrI
transliteration: Dosu N Raajay Raaneeai Poorab Likhatu N Mitai Likhaaree.
translation: For this, no king or queen is to be blamed; all this is due to the writ of previous births,

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix guru aupdysu n min aurDwrI
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Guru Oupadaysu N Mani Uradhaaree.
translation: Those who after listening to the word of the Guru and the teachings of the Guru do not adopt it in their mind.

gurmukhi: krmhIxu durmiq ihqkwrI ]10]
transliteration: Karam Heenu Duramati Hitakaaree ?10?
translation: They are of evil intellect and unfortunate.

gurmukhi: 11 pwrs qy p`Qr srIKy siqgur qy mnmuK
translation: Manmukh Cheat is like a stone

gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu iek Dwqu hoie sB ko kMcnu AwiK vKwxY
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Ik Dhaatu Hoi Sabh Ko Kanchanu Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: With the touch of philosopher's stone the eight metals become one metal and people call it gold.

gurmukhi: rUp AnUp srUp hoie muil Amulu pMc prvwxY
transliteration: Roop Anoop Saroop Hoi Muli Amulu Panch Paravaanai.
translation: That beautiful metal becomes gold and the jewellers also prove it to be gold.

gurmukhi: pQru pwris prsIAY pwrsu hoie n kul AiBmwxY
transliteration: Padaru Paarasi Paraseeai Paarasu Hoi N Kul Abhimaanai.
translation: Stone does not become philosopher's stone even after getting touched by it because the pride of family and hardness remains present in it (in fact the philosopher's stone is also but a stone).

gurmukhi: pwxI AMdir stIAY qV BV fubY Bwr BulwxY
transliteration: Paanee Andari Sateeai Tarh Bharh Doubai Bhaar Bhulaanai.
translation: Thrown in water, the stone full of pride of its weight sinks at once.

gurmukhi: icq kTor n iBjeI rhY inkoru GVY BMin jwxY
transliteration: Chit Katdor N Bhijaee Rahai Nikoru Gharhai Bhanni Jaanai.
translation: Hard-hearted stone never gets wet and from inside remains as dry as it was earlier. It only learns how to break pitchers.

gurmukhi: AgI AMdir Puit jwie Ahrix Gx AMdir hYrwxY
transliteration: Agee Andari Dhouti Jaai Aharani Ghan Andari Hairaanai.
translation: It cracks when put in fire and becomes brittle when hammered on anvil.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix gur aupdys n AMdir AwxY
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Gur Oupadays N Andari Aanai.
translation: Such person's also even after listening to the teachings of the Guru in the holy congregation do not keep to their heart the importance of the teachings.

gurmukhi: kpt snyhu n hoie iD|wxY ]11]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhu N Hoi Dhiaanai ?11?
translation: Showing fake affection, none can forcibly prove to be truthful.

gurmukhi: 12 hMs kwauN-gurmuK
translation: In the company of the swans -

gurmukhi: mwxk moqI mwnsir inrmlu nIru suQwauN suhMdw
transliteration: Maanak Motee Maanasari Niramalu Neeru Sadaau Suhandaa.
translation: Pure water, rubies and pearls adorn into the Manasarovar (lake).

gurmukhi: hMs vMsu inhcl mqI sMgiq pMgiq swQu bxMdw
transliteration: Hansu Vansu Nihachal Matee Sangati Pangati Saadu Banandaa.
translation: The family of the swans is of steadfast wisdom and they all live in groups and lines.

gurmukhi: mwxk moqI cog cuig mwxu mhqu AwnMdu vDMdw
transliteration: Maanak Motee Chog Chougi Maanu Mahitu Aanadu Vadhandaa.
translation: They enhance their prestige and delight by picking up rubies and pearls.

gurmukhi: kwNau inQwau innwau hY hMswN ivic audwsu hovMdw
transliteration: Kaau Nidaau Ninaau Hai Hansaa Vichi Udaasu Hovandaa.
translation: The crow there remains nameless, shelterless and dejected,

gurmukhi: BKu ABKu ABKu BK vx vx AMdr Brim BvMdw
transliteration: Bhakhu Abhakhu Abhakhu Bhakhu Van Van Andari Bharami Bhavandaa.
translation: The inedible it considers edible and to edible inedible, and goes on wandering from forest to forest.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd suix qn AMdir mnu iQru n rhMdw
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gurasabadu Souni Tan Andari Manu Diru N Rahandaa.
translation: So long as a person listening to the word of Guru in the holy congregation does not stabilise his body and mind.

gurmukhi: bjr kpwt n KulHY jMdw ]12]
transliteration: Bajar Kapaat N Khulhai Jandaa ?12?
translation: His stony gate (of wisdom) is not unlocked.

gurmukhi: 13 rogI rUp mnmuK
translation: Manmukh is an ailing person

gurmukhi: rogI mwxs hoie kY iPrdw bwhly vYd puCMdw
transliteration: Rogee Maanasu Hoi Kai Dhiradaa Baahalay Vaid Pouchhandaa.
translation: Suffering disease man goes about asking for treatment from many a physician.

gurmukhi: kcY vYd n jwxnI vydn dwrU rogI sMdw
transliteration: Kachai Vaid N Jaananee Vaydan Daaroo Rogee Sandaa.
translation: Since the inexperienced physician does not know the problem of the patient as well as the medicine for the same.

gurmukhi: horo dwrU rogu hoir hoie pcwieV duK shMdw
transliteration: Horo Daaroo Rogu Hour Hoi Pachaairh Doukh Sahandaa.
translation: The suffering person goes suffering more and more.

gurmukhi: AwvY vYdu suvYdu Gir dwrU dsY rogu lhMdw
transliteration: Aavai Vaidu Suvaidu Ghari Daaroo Dasai Rogu Lahandaa.
translation: If a mature physician is found, he prescribes the right medicine, which removes the malady.

gurmukhi: sMjim rhY n Kwie pQu Ktw imTw swau cKMdw
transliteration: Sanjami Rahai N Khaai Padu Khataa Mitdaa Saau Chakhandaa.
translation: Now, if the patient does not follow the prescribed discipline and goes on to eat everything sweet and sour, the physician is not to be blamed.

gurmukhi: dosu n dwrU vYd no ivxu sMjim inq rogu vDMdw
transliteration: Dosu N Daaroo Vaid No Vinu Sanjami Nit Rogu Vadhandaa.
translation: For want of temperance the malady of the patient goes on increasing day and night.

gurmukhi: kpt snyhI hoie kY swDsMgiq ivic Awie bhMdw
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhee Hoi Kai Saadhasangati Vichi Aai Bahandaa.
translation: If a cheat even comes to the holy congregation and sits there.

gurmukhi: durmiq dUjY Bwie pcMdw ]13]
transliteration: Duramati Doojai Bhaai Pachandaa ?13?
translation: He being controlled by wickedness gets perished in his duality.

gurmukhi: 14 gDy qoN mnmuK dw rUpk
translation: Metaphor of donkey and the manmukh

gurmukhi: coAw cMdnu mydu lY mylu kpUr kQUrI sMdw
transliteration: Choaa Chandanu Maydu Lai Maylu Kapoor Kadooree Sandaa.
translation: Mixing the sandal oil, fragrance of the musk-cat, camphor, musk etc.

gurmukhi: sB sugMD rlwiekY guru gwNDI Argjw krMdw
transliteration: Sabh Sougandh Ralaai Kai Guru Gaandhee Aragajaa Karandaa.
translation: The perfumer prepares the scent.

gurmukhi: mjls AwvY swihbwN gux AMdir hoie gux mhkMdw
transliteration: Majalas Aavai Saahibaan Goun Andari Hoi Goun Mahakandaa.
translation: When using it, some one comes to the assembly of the experts, they all become full of fragrance.

gurmukhi: gdhw dyhI KaulIAY swr n jwxY nrk BvMdw
transliteration: Gadahaa Dayhee Khauleeai Saar N Jaanai Narak Bhavandaa.
translation: If the same fragrance is applied to an ass, it does not understand its importance and goes on wandering at dirty places.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gursbdu suix BwauBgiq ihrdY n DrMdw
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Bhaau Bhagati Hiradai N Dharandaa.
translation: Listening to the words of the Guru, one who does not adopt loving devotion in his heart.

gurmukhi: AMnHwN AKI hoNdeI bolw kMnwN sux n suxMdw
transliteration: Annhaan Akhee Hondaee Bolaa Kannaan Soun N Sounandaa.
translation: They are blind and deaf though they have eyes and ears.

gurmukhi: bDw ctI jwie BrMdw ]14]
transliteration: Badhaa Chatee Jaai Bharandaa ?14?
translation: In fact, he goes to the holy congregation under some compulsion.

gurmukhi: 15 pt, kMbl-gurmuK mnmuK
translation: Silk-wool, Gurmukh-manmukh, -

gurmukhi: Doqy hovin aujly pwt ptMbr Kry Amoly
transliteration: Dhotay Hovani Ujalay Paat Patanbar Kharai Amolay.
translation: The invaluable clothes made of silk come out bright when washed.

gurmukhi: rMg ibrMgI rMgIAin sBy rMg surMgu Afoly
transliteration: Rang Birangee Rangeean Sabhay Rang Surangu Adolay.
translation: Dye them in any colour they are beautiful in varied colours.

gurmukhi: swihb lY lY pYnHdy rUp rMg rs vMs inkoly
transliteration: Saahib Lai Lai Painhadai Roop Rang Ras Vasani Kolay.
translation: The aristocrat admirers of beauty, colour and joy purchase them and wear them.

gurmukhi: soBwvMqu suhwvxy cj Acwr sIgwr ivcoly
transliteration: Sobhaavantu Suhaavanay Chaj Achaar Seegaar Vicholay.
translation: There those clothes full of grandeur, become means of their adornment in marriage ceremonies.

gurmukhi: kwlw kMblu aujlw hoie n Doqy rMig inroly
transliteration: Kaalaa Kanbalu Ujalaa Hoi N Dhotai Rangi Nirolay.
translation: But a black blanket neither gets bright when washed nor can be dyed in any colour.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix JwkY AMdir nIru ivroly
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Jhaakai Andari Neeru Virolay.
translation: Like wise even after going to the holy congregation and listening to the teachings of the Guru, if someone goes on searching the World Ocean i.e. goes on to have desires for the worldly materials.

gurmukhi: kpt snyhI aujV Koly ]15]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhee Ujarh Kholay ?15?
translation: Such a cheat is like an abandoned and desolate place.

gurmukhi: 16 iql bUAwV-gurmuK mnmuK
translation: Manmukh is like a seedless sesame plant -

gurmukhi: KyqY AMdir jMimkY sB dUM au`cw hoie ivKwly
transliteration: Khaytai Andari Janmi Kai Sabh Doon Ouchaa Hoi Vikhaalay.
translation: Sesame plant growing in the field seems to be taller than all.

gurmukhi: bUtu vfw kir PYldw hoie cuhcuhw Awpu smwly
transliteration: Bootu Vadaa Kari Dhailadaa Hoi Chuhachuhaa Aapu Samaalay.
translation: On growing further it spreads all around verdantly and sustains itself.

gurmukhi: Kyiq sPl hoie lwvxI Cutin iqlu bUAwV inrwly
transliteration: Khayti Saphal Hoi Laavanee Chhoutani Tilu Booaarh Niraalay.
translation: On getting ripe when reaping begins, the seedless sesame plants are distinctly left out.

gurmukhi: inhPl swry Kyq ivic ijau srvwV kmwd ivcwly
transliteration: Nihaphal Saaray Khayt Vichi Jiu Saravaarh Kamaad Vichaalay.
translation: They are sonsidered useless as the thick growth of elephant grass is known worthless in the fields of sugarcane.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix kpt snyhu krin byqwly
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Kapat Sanayhu Karani Baytaalay.
translation: Even listening to the word of the Guru in the holy congregation those who do not keep any discipline, move around like ghosts.

gurmukhi: inhPl jnmu AkwrQw hliq pliq hovin muh kwly
transliteration: Nihaphal Janamu Akaaradaa Halati Palati Hovani Muh Kaalay.
translation: Their life becomes meaningless and they get their faces blackened here and in the hereafter.

gurmukhi: jmpuir jm jMdwir hvwly ]16]
transliteration: Jam Puri Jam Jandaari Havaalay ?16?
translation: In the abode of Yama (god of death) they are handed over the messengers of yama.

gurmukhi: 17 kYNhwN Ar sMK qoN mnmuK
translation: Manmukh is like bronze and conch

gurmukhi: aujl kYhwN iclkxw QwlI jyvix jUTI hovY
transliteration: Ujal Kaihaan Chilakanaa Daalee Jayvani Jootdee Hovay.
translation: The bronze appears shining and bright. After the food eaten from the bronze-plate, it becomes impure.

gurmukhi: jUiT suAwhU mwNjIAY gMgw jl AMdir lY DovY
transliteration: Jootdi Suaahoo Maanjeeai Gangaa Jal Andari Lai Dhovai.
translation: Its impurity is cleaned by ashes and then it is washed in the water of Ganges.

gurmukhi: bwhru sucw DoiqAwN AMdir kwlK AMiq ivgovY
transliteration: Baaharu Souchaa Dhotiaan Andari Kaalakh Anti Vigovai.
translation: Washing cleans externally but the blackness goes on to remain inside the inner core of heat.

gurmukhi: min jUTy qin jUiT hY Quik pvY muih vjY rovY
transliteration: Mani Jootday Tani Jootdi Hai Douki Pavai Muhi Vajai Rovai.
translation: The conch is impure outwardly and internally both because when blown, the spit goes in it. When it chimes, in fact it weeps because of the impurities in it.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix kpt snyhI glwN govY
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Gur Sabadu Souni Kapat Sanayhee Galaan Govai.
translation: Listening to the Word in the holy congregation the cheat talks nonsensically.

gurmukhi: glI qiRpiq n hoveI KMfu KMfu kir swau n BovY
transliteration: Galee Tripati N Hovaee Khandu Khandu Kari Saau N Bhovai.
translation: But by mere talking, none gets satisfied, as by mere uttering word sugar one cannot have his mouth sweet.

gurmukhi: mKnu Kwie n nIru ivlovY ]17]
transliteration: Makhanu Khaai N Neeru Vilovai ?17?
translation: If one is to eat butter, one should not go churning water, i.e. mere talks cannot produce the right results.

gurmukhi: 18 AirMf knyr-kpt snyhI
translation: Caster oil plant, oleander - cheat person -

gurmukhi: ruKwN ivic kuruK hin dovYN ArMf knyr duAwly
transliteration: Roukhaan Vichi Kuroukh Hani Dovain Arand Kanayr Duaalay.
translation: Worse among the trees, castor and oleander plants appear all around.

gurmukhi: ArMf PlY ArfolIAwN Pl AMdir bIA icqimqwly
transliteration: Arandu Phalai Aradoleeaan Phal Andari Beea Chitamitaalay.
translation: Flowers grow on castor and piebald seeds remain in them.

gurmukhi: inbhY nwhIN injVw hrvir AweI hoie aucwly
transliteration: Nibahai Naaheen Nijarhaa Haravari Aaee Hoi Ouchaalay.
translation: It has no deep roots and fast winds uproot it.

gurmukhi: klIAwN pvin knyr noN durmiq ivic durgMiD idKwly
transliteration: Kaleeaan Pavani Kanayr Non Duramati Vichi Durang Dikhaalay.
translation: On oleander plants grow buds which like evil sense scatter foul smell all around.

gurmukhi: bwhru lwlu gulwlu hoie AMdr ictw duibDw nwly
transliteration: Baaharu Laalu Gulaalu Hoi Andari Chitaa Doubidhaa Naalay.
translation: Outwardly they are like red rose but internally like a dilemmatic person they are white (because of the fear of many kinds).

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix gxqI ivic BvY Brnwly
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Ganatee Vichi Bhavai Bharanaalai.
translation: Even after listening to the word of the Guru in holy congregation if some body is still lost in the calculations, he goes astray in the world.

gurmukhi: kpt snyh Kyh muh kwly ]18]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayh Khayh Muhi Kaalay ?18?
translation: Ashes are thrown on the face of fake lover and his countenance is blackened.

gurmukhi: 19 A`k it`fw qy mnmuK
translation: Akk - a plant of sandy region. Grass hopper,leech and the Manmukh

gurmukhi: vx ivic PlY vxwspiq bhu rs gMD sugMD suhMdy
transliteration: Van Vichi Phalai Vanaasapati Bahu Rasu Gandh Sougandh Suhanday.
translation: In the forest adorns the vegetation of variegated colours.

gurmukhi: AMb sdw Pl sohxy AwVU syv Anwr PlMdy
transliteration: Anb Sadaa Phal Sohanai Aarhoo Sayv Anaar Phaladay.
translation: Mango is always considered a nice fruit and so is the peach, apple, pomegranate etc. which grows on trees.

gurmukhi: dwK ibjaurI jwmxU iKrxI qUq KjUir AnMdy
transliteration: Daakh Bijauree Jaamanoo Khiranee Toot Khajoori Anaday.
translation: Lemon sized grapes, plums, mimosaceous, mulberry, dates etc. all are delight giving fruits.

gurmukhi: pIlU pyJU byr bhu kyly qy AKrot bxMdy
transliteration: Peeloo Payjhoo Bayr Bahu Kaylay Tay Akhanot Bananday.
translation: Pilu, pejhu, ber, walnut, bananas, (all small and big Indian fruits) also grow on (Indian) trees.

gurmukhi: mUil n Bwvin Akitif AMmiRq Pl qij Aik vsMdy
transliteration: Mooli N Bhaavanee Akatidi Anmrit Phal Taji Aki Vasanday.
translation: But the grasshopper does not like them all and jumps to sit on akk, the wild plant of sandy region.

gurmukhi: jy Qx jok lvweIAY duD n pIAY lohU gMdy
transliteration: Jay Dan Jok Lavaaeeai Dudhu N Peeai Lohoo Ganday.
translation: If a leech is put on the teat of cow or buffalo, it will suck impure blood and not milk.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru sbdu suix gxqI AMdir JwK JKMdy
transliteration: Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Souni Ganatee Andari Jhaak Jhakhanday.
translation: Even after listening to the Word of the Guru in the holy congregation those who toss between the feelings of loss and profit.

gurmukhi: kpt snyh n Qyih jVMdy ]19]
transliteration: Kapat Sanayhi N Dayhi Jurhanday ?19?
translation: Their false love cannot reach any place.

gurmukhi: 20 mnmuK mwlw
translation: I have all the vices of manmukh

gurmukhi: ffU bgly sMK lK Ak jvwhy ibsIAr kwly
transliteration: Dadoo Bagalay Sankh Lakh Ak Javaahay Biseeari Kaalay.
translation: Millions of frogs, cranes, conches, plants of sandy regions (akk), camel, thorns (javas) black snakes;

gurmukhi: isMbl Gu`GU ckvIAwN kVC hsiq lK sMFI nwly
transliteration: Sinbal Ghoughoo Chakaveeaan Karhachh Hasati Lakh Sanddhee Naalay.
translation: Silk cotton trees, owls, ruddy sheldrakes, ladles, elephants, barren women;

gurmukhi: pQr kwv rogI Gxy gdhu kwly kMbl Bwly
transliteration: Padar Kaanv Rogee Ghanay Gadahu Kaalay Kanbal Bhaalay.
translation: Stones, crows, patients, donkeys, black blankets;

gurmukhi: kYhY iql bUAwV lK Akiqf ArMf qumy icqrwly
transliteration: Kaihai Til Booaarhi Lakh Akatid Arand Toumay Chitaraalay.
translation: Seedless sesame plants, castor, colocynths;

gurmukhi: klI knyr vKwxIAY sB Avgux mY qin BIhwly
transliteration: Kalee Kanayr Vakhaaneeai Sabh Avagoun Mai Tani Bheehaalay.
translation: Buds, oleanders (kaner) are there (in the world). All the deadly vices of all these I have in me.

gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix gur aupdysu n irdy smwly
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Gur Oupadaysu N Riday Samaalay.
translation: He, who even listening to the word of Guru in the holy congregation does not adopt the teachings of Guru in his heart.

gurmukhi: DiRgu jIvxu bymuK byqwly ]20]
transliteration: Dhrigu Jeevanu Baymoukh Baytaalay ?20?
translation: Is opposed to Guru and the life of such an imbalanced person is opprobrious.

gurmukhi: 21 inMdkwN qy bymuKwN dI igxqI
translation: Counting the slanderers and apostates

gurmukhi: lK inMdk lK bymuKwN dUq dust lK lUx hrwmI
transliteration: Lakh Nidak Lakh Baymoukhaan Doot Dousat Lakh Loon Haraamee.
translation: Millions are slanderers, millions are apostates and millions of wicked persons are untrue to their salt.

gurmukhi: sÍwim DohI AkiRqGix cor jwr lK lK pihnwmI
transliteration: Saamee Dhohee Akaritaghani Chor Jaar Lakh Lakh Pahinaamee.
translation: Unfaithful, ungrateful, thieves, vagabonds and millions of other infamous persons are there.

gurmukhi: bwmHx gweIN vMs Gwq lwieqbwr hjwr AswmI
transliteration: Baamhan Gaaeen Vans Ghaat Laaitabaar Hajaar Asaamee.
translation: Thousands are there who are slayers of Brahmin, cow, and their own family.

gurmukhi: kUiVAwr guru gop lK gunhgwr lK lK bdnwmI
transliteration: Koorhiaar Guru Gop Lakh Gounahagaar Lakh Lakh Badanaamee.
translation: Millions of liars, prevaricators of the Guru, guilty and ill-reputed ones are there.

gurmukhi: AprwDI bhu piqq lK AvguixAwr KuAwr KunwmI
transliteration: Aparaadhee Bahu Patit Lakh Avagouniaar Khuaar Khounaamee.
translation: Many a criminal, fallen, full of demerits and phoney people are there.

gurmukhi: lK ilbwsI dgwbwj lK sYqwn slwim slwmI
transliteration: Lakh Libaasee Dagaabaaj Lakh Saitaan Salaami Salaamee.
translation: Millions are there of variegated guises, cheats and friendly to Satan, exchanging greetings with them.

gurmukhi: qUM vyKih hau mukrw hau kptI qUM AMqirjwmI
transliteration: Toon Vaykhahi Hau Moukaraa Hau Kapatee Toon Antarijaamee.
translation: O God, you all know how I am denying (after having your gifts). I am a cheat and O Lord, you are omniscient.

gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu ibrdu suAwmI ]21]17]
transliteration: Patit Udhaaranu Biradu Suaamee ?21?17?sataaraan?
translation: O Master, you are uplifter of the fallen ones and your always keep your reputation.

gurmukhi: icrMkwl mwns jnm inrmol pwey sPl jnm gur crn srn kY
transliteration: Chirankaal Maanas Janam Niramol Paaay , Sadhal Janam Gur Charan Saran Kai ?
translation: After wandering many births, this human life is obtained. But the birth becomes successful only when one takes the refuge the holy feet of a True Guru.

gurmukhi: locn Amol gur drs Amol dyKy sÍn Amol gur bcn Drn kY
transliteration: Lochan Amol Gur Daras Amol Daykhay , Sravan Amol Gur Bachan Dharan Kai ?
translation: Eyes are invaluable only when they see a glimpse of the Lord ugh the form of Sat guru. Ears are fruitful if they listen the precepts and command of Satguru attentively.

gurmukhi: nwskw Amol crnwribMd bwsnw kY rsnw Amol gurmMqR ismrn kY
transliteration: Naasakaa Amol Charanaarabind Baasanaa Kai , Rasanaa Amol Gurmantr Simaran Kai ?
translation: Nostril’s are worthy only when they smell the fragrance of dust of Satguru's lotus-feet. The tongue becomes invaluable when it recites the word of the Lord given as consecration by Satguru Ji.

gurmukhi: hsn Amol gurdyv syv kY sPl crn Amol prdCnw krn kY ]17]
transliteration: Hasan Amol Gurdayv Sayv Kai Sadhala , Charan Amol Paradachhanaa Karan Kai ?17?
translation: Hands are invaluable only when they involve in the comforting service of Satguru and feet become precious when they ever stroll about in the vicinity of Satguru. (17)
